activities.loc: Monroe County Justice Center - Branch III

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon D. Borreson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon D. Borreson in court, in custody.  Attorney Carly June Sebion in court for Brandon D. Borreson.  Attorney Craig Gericke in court for Brandon D. Borreson.  Attorney Crystal N Long in court for State of Wisconsin. State calls Officer K. Guialski and was sworn in. State examines witness. Witness Identifies Defendant. Defense cross examines. Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed. Court binds over for trial. State is to file information by next Friday. Attorney waives reading of information. Court enters not guilty pleas. Attorney asks for a Status Hearing. Attorney asks to file a motion for bond in the next 2-3 weeks. Motion hearing to be scheduled by JA.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 20, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Status hearing scheduled for March 10, 2023 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on March 10, 2023 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
